I don't know what this app was supposed to do but so far it's done absolutely nothing regarding Covid-19 exposure. When I was exposed, it didn't alert me. When that exposure was reported to the local health department, it still didn't let me know. When I tried to manually update the app with exposure details ... well, that's not a feature so again I have to ask: what's this app supposed to do? Giving it two stars because I believe the intention was good but the execution was lackluster.

Not installing after reading the reviews! Absolutely useless fo collecting anything if you or your programers failed to include a link! As per usual... The government completing another job... well done

An essential app for public health. I received an exposure alert in November and it was very helpful. The bluetooth proximity sensor is a clever way to contact trace while maintaining privacy for users. I wish I could dismiss the "unable to check for exposures" alert that appears hourly if your bluetooth is off. I only have bluetooth on/exposure alerts enabled when I am at work around other people or out grocery shopping. When I am at home, alone, not doing anything or going out because there's a global pandemic, I wish this app would stop bugging me to turn on bluetooth. This was not previously an issue. I can understand this from a public health perspective- you want to avoid people forgetting to turn the app off. But really, the hourly reminders are very annoying and actually unnecessary for a lot of users.
This app was really good at telling me when my GPS was off. Never received any other notifications in the ~6 months that it was installed.
Intellgince HQ, International Confirmation Grid : to individual users / devices. Focus Efficiency foundation groud 0. Start up.
Are you freaking kidding me, this just another way of controlling people grow the f up
To notify somebody if I have been exposed it asks for a verification code that was never given to me....so there's no way for me to notify. It defeats the purpose of having the app.

I downloaded the app the week it launched and hadn't gotten even one notification by the time I uninstalled it on 3/20. Maybe I'm just ridiculously lucky to have avoided all exposure, but between case numbers, quarantines in my workplace, people not receiving positivity codes, and codes going unused, it seems much more likely that this app doesn't work well in practice. Mostly a waste of phone space, but one star for giving a false sense of contributing to public health.
Good

I have a question.. If your app uses Bluetooth to recognize other phones and that phone's user's status, what happens if I 'always' listen to music on Bluetooth headphones when out in downtown.. Is your app useless in this situation?
Used to only notify you once about bluetooth, now does it all the time. That incentivizes me to uninstall since you cannot turn that notification off. Unfortunate.

Confusing app. When you go to notify the app you have covid it prompts you to enter a notification code. But the text message you receive doesn't contain a code, but a link you click on and follow prompts. The text I got after testing positive came 2 days later and was in a spam folder (I didn't know my phone filtered suspected spam). So I kept thinking I didn't have the verification code & contacted CDPHE several times to no avail. They should email the info too & have an FAQ on the app.
Great app!!!

It makes no sense that if we are trying to control the spread if this disease that this program doesn't seem a bit more comprehensive. After the fact seems a bit useless. Besides, it sucks battery.

This is an excellent tool. I think they could do a better job informing people on how they get the code to start the notification part though. For those interested, the health department can generate the code for you when you receive a call from a contact tracer. You cannot just trigger it based on a positive test result. Please answer the phone when they call after you have been tested or call them back.
Don't work I know people at my work have it and this doesn't say anything

Called county health department to ask about notification & special code issue. RESULTS: 1) testing agency reports positive tests to the State 2) State notifies counties in which the positive people live 3) w/in 24 hrs, counties notify people who tested positive 4)w/in 48 hrs (cases are mounting),Contact Tracers call infected people & ask w/whom they have been in contact. NO REASON for infected people to need code. Call Labor Dept if there's a work issue. RECOMMEND: call people who know things.

Anonymous and opt-in only so your information and privacy is protected. Since it's release, the old manual verification system has been updated to be more automated. This app can save lives and works better when more users have it installed.
I would like the app to have some way to tell me that I have exchanged tokens with someone, maybe giving me a total for a day. No details, just some indication that the app is doing its job.
Yes. It is safe to use. It uses tokens and your identity is kept private. Please, please do your part and help stop/track the spread!

It does work for sharing a positive result! But don't go into the app because you'll get stopped at the verification code part. Instead wait for a text message from the health department - click on that link and follow the steps. It does share that way! You'll even see evidence that it was shared in the app. Would have given 5 stars but no explanation about the verification code or follow up text was given.

major power consumption issues. had to uninstall it because I couldn't use my phone normally without having to charge in the middle of the day, and I only really text on an average day. also noticed my phone was running very hot constantly when I had the app installed. this is something we definitely need, but please optimize it so it doesn't make my phone unusable.

DOES NOT WORK! I work for a government entity and we recently had three positive cases on our floor alone in this building and we didn't get a single notification not when it started and not two weeks later. This app is a complete failure and a waste of your battery time and space!

replyContent: Getting the error "Something went wrong, try again"? If so this issue is a known problem, and the fix is being rolled out. We recommend turning off Exposure Notifications by going to Settings > Google > Exposure Notifications (toggle off) & then installing CO Exposure Notifications.

content: This app is useless. In order to report your positive result it asks for a verification code but doesn't give you one and doesn't have any instructions for how to get one. It would be a valuable tool if it worked.

Downloaded this twice. Immediately annoying notifications that it will not work without an update. Takes you to Google Play to update and crashes. I could have written a better app, and I'm not an IT graduate yet!!! Pretty damn poor when the COVID situation is so serious....

5 stars for the importance and purpose of using this app. However... To all of you saying this doesn't track location... Your wrong! Yes it doesn't use GPS... But... bluetooth can collect the GPS location data of other devices that your phones blue tooth connects to... Therefore it tracks your location because your in the vicinity of someone else whose location is known because they're gps might be on, or they're 3/4g is communicating their location. Smart phone = tracked inevitably!
False positive. Interestingly enough I haven't been within 50 ft of anyone in several days. Uninstalling this pharmaceutical company sponsored quasi-gov tracker.

I don't think this works. I have been exposed twice through the doctors office I work in and notified but nothing from this app. How do you get your numbers and notify someone? I've even left my location on, still nothing. Deleting app!

Do not download, the government is trying to track everyone via cellphone. If you do download, make sure to read the message pop-up as soon as u open the app. If my comment is deleted, I will know I was right and so will whoever sees this...
Currently I'm rating it 5 because it's a great idea. I guess I won't know more until it notifies me if I've been exposed. But what if I happen to have it and don't know it? Can it notify me of that?

Good call, Colorado but an issue with the app is that there is no verification code sent when trying to enter test results. I suggest you make this process a little more clear, and provide an FAQ if anyone else has run into this as well.

Published:September 23, 2020 11:08 PM EDT Updated:September 26, 2020 11:51 AM EDT A CDC update Wednesday says individuals are more likely to survive the coronavirus after contracting it. The health agency says if you have the virus between the ages of 0 to 70, you have a 99% survival rate. And if you’re over 70, the survival rate is nearly 95%. While this CDC update is a relief for many, doctors are extremely worried, and an NCH Healthcare System doctor hopes you still take precautions.
You want to say your privacy advocate but you do need location data on if you have android 10 or lower. Hum...

This tool has a serious flaw. In order to notify others of a positive test result, you need a verification code. There is no explanation as to how to get this verification code. I have found media articles saying that a contact tracer may call me and provide this number. I'm on day five of potentially exposing others. I am not the only one experiencing this issue. Please communicate how we are supposed to verify positive test results.
Protecting my neighbors as I protect myself
Well designed6
Interesting stuff

This is a great idea in theory. Unfortunately when you try to report a positive test result it asks for a verification code. To get a code you must look up your local public health agency, call them and ask to speak to a COVID-19 case investigator. Then give that person a bunch of information in order to get a code (none of which is explained on the app itself). With this much hassle required in order to simply report a result, this app is doomed to be an utter failure.
Maybe I'm not understanding something but when I try to share my results, It says it will send me a one time verification code, but nothing happens.

This app is completely useless. I have been around three people who are verified positive for covid-19. Also my wife just had a positive covid-19 test and we have not been able to put that information on the application because there's nowhere to find a code to enter that is requesting. Might as well just remove this app completely.
I can't start this app. I keep getting an error something went wrong message.
Needs gps and bluetooth to be active. Drains battery. Why do we need gps active.
Don't know much about what everything is. But I care about my Denver. Whatever helps. May we be blessed great and small.

Really glad Colorado has rolled this out and it seems like they did this with a huge focus on privacy. One question : if you are notified, does it make any noise like amber alert style? Or play the death march? Only morbidly curious.
Thank you Colorado, it will be so much easier to notify people who i may have can in contact with.
Won't download. "Something went wrong. Try again." Contacted support, their suggestions (from Google) didn't help. But at least they're aware and working on a fix.
Love how it uses Bluetooth rather than GPS so it does not track us and does not know our location. Great solution for COVID tracing while maintaining privacy.
I never can get past the set up process without it erroring out.

The app itself is fine, but installing it caused my other apps trying to update to do so slowly. So slowly, that on a fast wifi connection it would take more than 30 minutes for just one to do so. I uninstalled this one and might try again later. Once this was uninstalled, the normal updates had no problem
Necessary and useful during the pandemic.
Love the concept. Not a fan that it requires bluetooth to turn on notifications. That's a battery drain.
Works for right now. No issue installing. Straight forward and easy. I would recommend it. Do your part!!!
Loopy.
100 percent private
It does use location info
Error: "Something went wrong. Try again." Why would Wyoming's app work, but Colorado app has this lame error?
Clean and efficient app that does exactly what it needs to!
Location services should not be required! The Google/Apple technology should not require location services to be on for the app to function. The tokens work via Bluetooth, not GPS.
replyContent: Thanks for sharing this concern. Exposure Notifications uses Bluetooth scanning to understand what devices are near one another. Phones with Android 6.0 to 10 require the permission you mentioned, but location is not used in this app. More details are available from Google in this support document https://support.google.com/android/answer/9930236

content: Just uses bluetooth. No security risks.
I love the idea and the initiative, but it's killing my daily battery life.
Looks good.
Let's stop the spread together!
Great concept but kills my battery. I do have an old phone though so that may be the issue.
Its safe, and created with privacy in mind

While your installing this IT DOSE ASK FOR YOUR LOCATION ! I haven't gotten to use this app yet I'm just now installing it so unlike other comments who claim THEY DO NOT ask for a location I paid attention and yes it dose .
Research says even if just a small % reports, we can trace the spread better. This will allow us to open *without* playing russian (covid) roulette with people's lives.
Works as expected. Minor privacy concerns vs the public health benefit this represents.

The ui is very clean, and the app runs well, no chonkyness, no extra battery drain (other than Bluetooth being on). It does not need your location, and the way they track which devices you've been near is completely anonymous to everyone except the CO health department. (because then they couldn't notify you)
Just what we need! Thanks for doing this!

As a professional software engineer I fully endorce the anonymity and privacy claims of this app. As a human I appreciate learning about possible covid exposure ASAP. The more people who have it the better it works, so please download it!

Do your part and wear a mask everyone. Doesn't take that much common sense. If we can get stupid people to not throw a fit over the simplest things whenever they say, "YoU are ViOlAtInG mY lIbErTy AnD mY rIgHtS!!!", this app is our last hope. I don't get why Americans have to be the stupidest people to ever exist 24/7. 365 days a year. Stupider than infants who were born 1/6400 of a second ago (straight up facts btw).
It communicates via Bluetooth, which drains the battery. Swing and a miss.

Love the concept, but wish there was a way to share more information if I get a positive test. I know privacy is a huge concern, but if I could state that I was wearing a mask at a store, or shared food at a party, that would make a big difference to people deciding to quarantine or not after getting the notification.
No GPS tracking, very simple, requires no effort. Thank you.

As an independent security analyst I endorse and support the use of this app. There are no *general* high risk concerns for the methods used with the app. Contrary to some comments, the app is not requiring or requesting location access and can be denied any such privileges manually if desired (though it never requested them to begin with). Please, please. Use this app. Control the spread.
We need this right. Of because of the virus
Caused crash an hour after installation. 2 of my established apps were stopped.
replyContent: Hi, sorry to hear you’ve been experiencing some crash issues. Please contact us at CO_Exposure_Notifications@state.co.us and share details of the crashes. We will definitely investigate your case. Thank you for posting!

content: Increased information, no loss of privacy. Solid win. I've read through "how it works" and I'm super impressed. Now we just need everyone to use it.
This app seems like a very good idea I hope it works!
Finally. Other countries have had a tracing app for months. It would be ideal if it was nationwide and mandatory, instead of state level and optional, but I'll take what I can get.
This app is just smart for every Coloradan to have on their phone. Plus it has dark mode.
Registered on Google and Amazon but PRIVACY IS AN ISSUE!!! 🙄🙄🙄 The irony some people have.
I'm willing to try anything that will keep us healthy.

Great privacy measures, no permissions whatsoever, uses low energy bluetooth(like the scanning iphone uses to detect airpods), PEACE OF MIND.
Great idea. Does not share your personal info or track it for that matter.
I can't turn on notifications? It just says something went wrong?
replyContent: Thank you for downloading CO Exposure Notifications! This issue is a known problem, and the fix is being rolled out. We recommend turning off Exposure Notifications by going to Settings > Google > Exposure Notifications (toggle off) and then installing CO Exposure Notifications. There is no need to uninstall your other Exposure Notifications apps.

content: Install it! It's anonymous, no location given to the State of Colorado or anyone else.
Does what it says privately
Just signed on and it seems easy to use and understand. I'll amend rating if needed but so far so good.
Good move CO - will update this review as time goes on if the app has any issues

I had trouble getting the notifications to work like a lot of people had posted, I uninstalled and reinstalled the app and it worked the next time. Not sure what causes this. Glad we have some form of contact tracing!

Private and secure. Blind stats accessed to give you notifications if your account token matches a confirmed positive token. No information about you, your phone, your location. Only this token met that token and your account can grab the info about your token. That's it. Absolute privacy. Keep each other safe, good health to you all.
Thank you! Telling everyone I know this has been released
We needed this for such a long time. Thank you!!!
The title makes it sounds like a carbon monoxide detector -why no mention of COVID-19 or "infectious disease"?
It's unfortunate that it was delayed this long but I'll be trying to get everyone I know to turn on exposure notifications!

I'm a strong privacy advocate. This is a good trade between helping others via trading anonymous information and not tracking movement. If you're worried about the government directly tracking you, remember they can do that via the cell network without need of an app. If you're worried about businesses tracking you, remember to avoid Facebook and disable cookies. I don't advocate for giving up freedoms without safeguards and good reasons. Just wish the code was open source for further review.
As long as your OS is up to date it doesn't ask for location permission. Hoping to see this type of app expand outside of Colorado.

There is no need to uninstall your other Exposure Notifications apps.

content: So grateful we finally have this available. We all need to have the data to make good decisions
Finally, now let's see if people use it.
Easy. Private. Secure. Gets us back to normal faster. No brainer.

Reprehensible security risk to phones. You can't have Bluetooth turned on the entire time and not expect your phone to possibly be hacked. In fact in the initial permissions, the app turns your Bluetooth on without fully disclosing that it will be on 24-7. Much greater risk than the benefits of this well-intended app. Do better..
Thank you!
This fantastic. Thank you!
Simple. Does what it is supposed to. Thanks

Be careful, a later update will be you will have to put in a code after you get the vaccine. If your app does not show you took the vaccine you will be restricted to things. That's why you still have to allow locations settings even though this works with a bluetooth token process... its coming!
Very clean and simple. Love it!

This is really a no brainier. Scalable contact tracing with great privacy. It's a dirty secret in tech that it works great decentralized, without central control. It's just that companies and governments weren't willing to give up that control until now.
Very good

It's only as good as the number of people who choose to use it, it's not some magic bullet OR nefarious deep state conspiracy brought to reality. But please use it, and tell others about it, and as more folks come on board it can hopefully become another of our tools in the toolbox to mitigate and reduce the spread of covid in our area! 😷👍
Saved and Protected the life of many.
A well designed and timely app to protect the health of all Cororado residents.
After like 8 months of covid we FINALLY have a covid exposure app!?!!!????
Small app, does only what it should and doesn't require privacy-invading permissions.

You are not required to share your location. It asks for zero permissions. You get one pop up explaining it does not use GPS in any fashion. Very happy to help my community open up safer and faster. We all want to same end result.

For those with privacy complaints: **Before you ask, this app doesn't have location access.** When you turn on this app, it will generate random numbers every so often and share these numbers with a central server. When you pass by someone in bluetooth range, it will share your current number with them. If they report positive, all numbers they have been around will be notified of the positive test. No names, no locations. Simple, private, secure. I like it.
Intuitive and so easy to install! Do your part CO and participate!
